705484f-a.text:
Livingston Street, west from Bond Street, showing more of the north side of the street and the trolley terminal, a converging point for many of Brooklyn's street car lines. Also shown is Loeser's Department Store, extending to Elm Place: on the west side of the latter is Namm's Department Store (white building), and beyond that is the Abraham and Straus store.
Views 2 and 3 show a passenger safety isle.
View 1: November, 1935
Views 2,3: June 15, 1940
P. L. Sperr
iew tviewo E-  AC5  NEG. SO20

vihu

705485f-a.text:
Livingston Street, north side, east from Bond Street to Hanover Place. The building occupied by the Spear's furniture
people was formerly the New Montauk Theatre.
June 15, 1940
P. L. Sperr
